solution_line_template: First find the size of the gap the dragon needs to close to burn Xena: {head_start_distance} ft - {burn_distance} ft = <<{head_start_distance}-{burn_distance}={distance_to_close}>>{distance_to_close} ft

Then find how many feet closer the dragon gets each second by subtracting Xena's speed from the dragon's speed: {dragon_speed} ft/sec - {xena_speed} ft/sec = <<{dragon_speed}-{xena_speed}={relative_speed}>>{relative_speed} ft/sec

Then divide the distance by the speed difference to find how many seconds it takes for the dragon to get close enough to burn Xena: {distance_to_close} ft / {relative_speed} ft/sec = <<{distance_to_close}/{relative_speed}={time_to_burn}>>{time_to_burn} sec
